name: Falmouth
description: Falmouth is a vibrant coastal town located on the southwestern tip of Cape Cod, Massachusetts. Known for its beautiful beaches, scenic harbors, and rich maritime history, Falmouth offers a perfect blend of natural beauty and small-town charm. With its proximity to Martha's Vineyard, thriving arts scene, and numerous outdoor activities, Falmouth is a popular destination for visitors seeking a quintessential Cape Cod experience.

attractions.name: Old Silver Beach
attractions.description: A stunning beach with warm, calm waters and picturesque views of Buzzards Bay. Popular for swimming, sunbathing, and watching spectacular sunsets.

attractions.name: Nobska Lighthouse
attractions.description: An iconic 19th-century lighthouse offering panoramic views of Vineyard Sound, the Elizabeth Islands, and Martha's Vineyard. Tours available seasonally.
attractions.opening_hours: Grounds open daily; Tower tours available seasonally

attractions.name: Falmouth Museums on the Green
attractions.description: A complex of historic buildings and gardens showcasing Falmouth's rich history through exhibits, guided tours, and special events.
attractions.opening_hours: Tuesday-Friday: 10:00 AM - 3:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM - 1:00 PM (May-October)

attractions.name: Spohr Gardens
attractions.description: A tranquil six-acre garden featuring daffodils, rhododendrons, and various other flowers, as well as scenic water views and unique sculptures.

attractions.name: Woods Hole Science Aquarium
attractions.description: The oldest public aquarium in the United States, featuring exhibits on marine life of the Northeast and Mid-Atlantic waters. Touch tanks and seal feeding demonstrations available.
attractions.opening_hours: Tuesday-Saturday: 11:00 AM - 4:00 PM (hours may vary seasonally)

restaurants.name: The Glass Onion
restaurants.description: An upscale bistro offering sophisticated New American cuisine with a focus on locally sourced ingredients. Known for its intimate atmosphere and excellent wine list.

restaurants.name: Quarterdeck Restaurant
restaurants.description: A local favorite serving fresh seafood and classic New England fare in a casual waterfront setting. Enjoy views of Falmouth Harbor while dining.
restaurants.opening_hours: Daily: 11:30 AM - 9:00 PM (seasonal hours may vary)

restaurants.name: Maison Villatte
restaurants.description: An authentic French bakery offering a wide selection of artisanal breads, pastries, and light lunch options. Known for its croissants and baguettes.

restaurants.name: Anejo Mexican Bistro
restaurants.description: A vibrant restaurant serving creative Mexican cuisine and craft cocktails. Features a lively bar area and outdoor seating.

accommodations.name: Sea Crest Beach Hotel
accommodations.description: A beachfront resort offering comfortable rooms, multiple dining options, indoor and outdoor pools, and direct access to Old Silver Beach.

accommodations.name: The Palmer House Inn
accommodations.description: A charming Victorian-era B&B located in Falmouth's historic district, offering elegant rooms, gourmet breakfasts, and easy access to downtown attractions.

accommodations.name: Inn on the Square
accommodations.description: A centrally located hotel with comfortable rooms, an indoor pool, and within walking distance to Falmouth's shops, restaurants, and beaches.

accommodations.name: The Captain's Manor Inn
accommodations.description: A luxurious inn set in a beautifully restored 1849 home, featuring spacious rooms, lovely gardens, and gourmet breakfasts.

activities.name: Shining Sea Bikeway
activities.description: A scenic 10.7-mile paved bike path running from North Falmouth to Woods Hole, offering beautiful views of the coastline, cranberry bogs, and salt marshes.
activities.address: County Rd, North Falmouth, MA 02556 (northern terminus)

activities.name: Island Queen Ferry
activities.description: A passenger ferry service offering a scenic 35-minute trip from Falmouth to Oak Bluffs on Martha's Vineyard. Perfect for day trips or longer stays on the island.

activities.name: Falmouth Commodores Baseball
activities.description: Catch a summer baseball game featuring top college players in the prestigious Cape Cod Baseball League.
activities.opening_hours: Games typically held in June and July

activities.name: Kayaking and Paddleboarding
activities.description: Explore Falmouth's coastline, harbors, and nearby islands by kayak or paddleboard. Rentals and guided tours available for all skill levels.

events.name: Falmouth Road Race
events.description: A world-renowned 7-mile road race attracting elite runners and thousands of participants. Held annually in August.

events.name: Woods Hole Film Festival
events.description: An annual independent film festival featuring screenings, workshops, and panel discussions. Typically held in late July/early August.
events.location: Various venues in Woods Hole and Falmouth
